intro: Xanthoxalis dumetorum, commonly known as the yellow wood sorrel, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is characterized by its trifoliate leaves, which are often covered in fine hairs, and its clusters of small, yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or stream banks. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes other cruciferous plants. Xanthoxalis dumetorum is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive foliage and delicate blooms.
